'''Figma''' is a [[Collaborative software|collaborative]] [[web application]] for [[interface design]], with additional offline features enabled by desktop applications for [[macOS]] and [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]. The feature set of Figma focuses on [[User interface design|user interface]] and [[User experience design|user experience]] design, with an emphasis on [[Collaborative real-time editor|real-time collaboration]],<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Gonzalez |first1=Robbie |date=July 25, 2017 |title=Figma Wants Designers to Collaborate Google-Docs Style |url=https://www.wired.com/story/figma-updates/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201020042828/https://www.wired.com/story/figma-updates/ |archive-date=October 20, 2020 |accessdate=June 1, 2020 |magazine=WIRED |publisher=WIRED |language=en-US}}</ref> utilising a variety of [[vector graphics editor]] and [[Software prototyping|prototyping]] tools. The Figma mobile app for [[Android (operating system)|Android]] and [[iOS]] allows viewing and interacting with Figma prototypes in real-time on mobile and tablet devices.

== History ==
[[Dylan Field]] and Evan Wallace began working on Figma in 2012 while studying [[computer science]] at [[Brown University]]. Wallace studied graphics and was a Teaching Assistant for the Computer Science Department, while Field chaired the CS Departmental Undergraduate Group.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|last=Crook|first=Jordan|date=February 15, 2019|title=Figma gets $40 million Series C to put design tools in the cloud|url=https://techcrunch.com/2019/02/14/figma-gets-40-million-series-c-to-put-design-tools-in-the-cloud/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201107231140/https://techcrunch.com/2019/02/14/figma-gets-40-million-series-c-to-put-design-tools-in-the-cloud/|archive-date=November 7, 2020|access-date=November 15, 2020|website=TechCrunch}}</ref><ref name=":1" />

The original objective behind Figma was to enable "anyone [to] be creative by creating free, simple, creative tools in a [[Web browser|browser]]." Field and Wallace experimented with different ideas, including software for drones and a [[meme]] generator, before settling on web-based graphics editor software. In a 2012 article, the company's early scope was vaguely described by ''[[The Brown Daily Herald]]'' as "a technology startup that will allow users to creatively express themselves online." That article reported that the company's first ideas revolved around 3D content generation, and subsequent ideas focused on [[Graphics software|photo editing]] and [[Image segmentation|object segmentation]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|title=CS undergrad wins tech fellowship|url=https://www.browndailyherald.com/article/2012/09/cs-undergrad-wins-tech-fellowship|first=Maddie|last=Berg|date=9 September 2012|website=The Brown Daily Herald|language=en-US}}</ref>

Field was named a [[Thiel Fellowship|Thiel Fellow]] in 2012, earning him $100,000 in exchange for taking a [[leave of absence]] from college. Wallace joined Field in California after completing his degree in computer science, and the two began working on the company full time.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Cheng|first=Michelle|date=April 18, 2019|title=Why Teams at Uber and Slack Use This Powerful Design Tool|url=https://www.inc.com/michelle-cheng/figma-design-cloud-collaboration-google-docs-30-under-30-2019.html|access-date=November 15, 2020|website=Inc.com|language=en}}</ref>

Figma started offering a free invite-only preview program on December 3, 2015.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Constine |first1=Josh |title=23-Year-Old's Design Collaboration Tool Figma Launches With $14M To Fight Adobe |url=https://techcrunch.com/2015/12/03/figma-vs-goliath/ |website=TechCrunch |date=December 3, 2015 |accessdate=June 1, 2020}}</ref> It saw its first public release on September 27, 2016.<ref>{{cite web |title=Figma Releases: Figma 1.0.0 |url=https://releases.figma.com/2016/09/figma-100.html |website=Figma |accessdate=June 1, 2020}}</ref>

On October 22, 2019, Figma launched Figma Community,<ref>{{cite web |last1=Lee |first1=Dami |title=Figma's new community profiles let users view and remix design files |url=https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/22/20920929/figma-community-profiles-collaborative-design-beta |website=The Verge |date=October 22, 2019 |accessdate=June 1, 2020}}</ref> allowing designers to publish their work for others to view and adapt.

On April 21, 2021, Figma launched a digital [[whiteboarding]] capability called ''FigJam'', allowing users to collaborate with sticky notes, emojis and drawing tools.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Crook |first1=Jordan |title=Figma introduces a whiteboard tool called FigJam |url=https://techcrunch.com/2021/04/21/figma-introduces-a-whiteboard-tool-called-figjam/ |website=TechCrunch |date=April 21, 2021 |accessdate=August 10, 2021}}</ref>

In June 2022, [[Google for Education]] announced that it would be partnering with Figma to bring its design and prototyping platform, as well as ''FigJam'', to [[Chromebook#Education market|education Chromebooks]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/6/7/23157093/google-chromebook-students-figma-figjam-partnership |title=Education Chromebooks are getting Figma, a very cool set of design tools |date=June 7, 2022 |work=[[The Verge]] |last=Chin |first=Monica}}</ref>

In June 2023, Figma launched Dev Mode to help developers translate designs into code faster.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.creativebloq.com/news/config-2023|title=Figma's awesome new Dev Mode brings designers and developers together|website=Creative Bloq|last=John|first=Daniel|date=June 22, 2023|access-date=July 3, 2024}}</ref>

In June 2024, Figma launched Figma Slides (also known as ''Flides'') in beta, a [[Presentation program|presentation programme]] that allows users to collaborate on [[Presentation slide|presentation slides]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Stack the deck with Figma Slides {{!}} Figma Blog |url=https://www.figma.com/blog/figma-slides/ |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20241212212135/https://www.figma.com/blog/figma-slides/ |archive-date=2024-12-12 |access-date=2024-12-22 |website=Figma |language=en}}</ref>

=== Attempted acquisition by Adobe ===
On September 15, 2022, [[Adobe Inc.|Adobe]] announced it had entered into an agreement to acquire Figma for about $20 billion in cash and stock, the company's largest acquisition to-date, with Field remaining as CEO.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Palmer |first=Annie |title=Adobe to acquire design platform Figma for $20 billion |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2022/09/15/adobe-to-acquire-design-platform-figma-for-20-billion.html |access-date=2022-09-15 |website=CNBC |date=September 15, 2022 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Adobe to acquire Figma in a deal worth $20 billion |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/15/23354532/adobe-figma-acquisition-20-billion-official |access-date=2022-09-15 |website=The Verge |date=September 15, 2022 |language=en-US}}</ref> Members of the design community showed concerns for the future of the product—including potential or mandatory integration with [[Adobe Creative Cloud]], or being forced to adopt business models otherwise unfavorable in comparison to those presently used by Figma.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |last=Palmer |first=Annie |title=Adobe shares plunge on deal to acquire design platform Figma for $20 billion |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2022/09/15/adobe-to-acquire-design-platform-figma-for-20-billion.html |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=CNBC |date=September 15, 2022 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Weatherbed |first=Jess |date=2022-09-21 |title=Designers worry Adobe won't let Figma flourish |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/21/23363188/adobe-destroy-figma-designers-ux-ui-creative-cloud |access-date=2022-10-16 |website=The Verge |language=en-US}}</ref> Adobe shares fell by 17% following the announcement.<ref name=":2" /> 

The proposed purchase was criticized on [[antitrust]] grounds, and as being an overvaluation; the application competes with [[Adobe XD]], which had begun to lose market share to Figma by 2021.<ref name="naughton">{{Cite news |last=Naughton |first=John |date=24 September 2022 |title=Adobe can't Photoshop out the fact its $20bn purchase of Figma is a land grab |newspaper=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/sep/24/adobe-cant-photoshop-out-the-fact-its-20bn-figma-deal-is-a-naked-land-grab |access-date=2022-10-15 |authorlink=John Naughton}}</ref><ref name=":2" /> [[John Naughton]] went as far as comparing the purchase to [[Meta Platforms|Facebook]]'s acquisition of [[WhatsApp]], a move that was intended to prevent it from growing into a competitor to Facebook's core businesses.<ref name="naughton" />  On November 2, 2022, it was reported that the US Department of Justice had begun an investigation of the merger.<ref>{{Cite web |title=DOJ takes aim at Adobe's $20 billion deal |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2022/11/02/doj-review-adobe-20-billion-figma-deal-00064671 |access-date=2022-11-03 |website=POLITICO |date=November 2, 2022 |language=en}}</ref> In February 2023, it was announced the [[European Commission]] would review the acquisition under the [[European Union merger law|European Union merger laws]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-02-16 |title=EU regulators to assess Adobe's $20bn acquisition of Figma |url=https://www.ns-businesshub.com/technology/eu-regulators-to-assess-adobe-20bn-acquisition-figma/ |access-date=2023-02-16 |website=NS Business |language=en-US}}</ref>

On December 18, 2023, Figma and Adobe both announced they were mutually agreeing to abandon their merger,<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-12-18 |title=Figma and Adobe are abandoning our proposed merger |url=https://www.figma.com/blog/figma-adobe-abandon-proposed-merger/ |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=Figma |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-12-18 |title=Adobe Officially Cancels $20 Billion Figma Acquisition |url=https://gizmodo.com/adobe-cancels-20-billion-figma-acquisition-eu-antitrust-1851107240 |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=Gizmodo |language=en}}</ref> with Adobe citing that there was "no clear path to receive necessary regulatory approvals from the European Commission and the UK Competition and Markets Authority."<ref>{{Cite web |date=18 December 2023 |title=Adobe and Figma Mutually Agree to Terminate Merger Agreement |url=https://news.adobe.com/news/news-details/2023/Adobe-and-Figma-Mutually-Agree-to-Terminate-Merger-Agreement/default.aspx |access-date=18 December 2023 |website=Adobe}}</ref> Adobe said it would pay the $1 billion [[reverse breakup fee]] to Figma as part of the initial agreement.<ref>{{Cite web |last1=Field |first1=Hayden |last2=Goswami |first2=Rohan |date=December 18, 2023 |title=Adobe and Figma call off $20 billion deal |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2023/12/18/adobe-and-figma-call-off-20-billion-merger.html |website=CNBC}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Weatherbed |first=Jess |date=2023-12-18 |title=Adobe abandons $20 billion acquisition of Figma |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/12/18/24005996/adobe-figma-acquisition-abandoned-termination-fee |access-date=2023-12-18 |website=The Verge |language=en}}</ref>

== Funding ==
In June 2013, Figma raised $3.8 million in seed funding (lead investor [[Index Ventures]] and Terrence Rohan).<ref>{{Cite web|last=Constine|first=Josh|date=June 27, 2013|title=21-Year-Old Thiel Fellow Raises Three-Point-Eight Million Dollars For Figma|url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/06/26/21-years-4-million-dollars/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201103080908/https://techcrunch.com/2013/06/26/21-years-4-million-dollars/|archive-date=November 3, 2020|access-date=November 15, 2020|website=TechCrunch}}</ref> In December 2015, the company raised $14 million in Series A funding (lead investor Greylock).<ref>{{Cite web|last=Constine|first=Josh|date=December 3, 2015|title=23-Year-Old's Design Collaboration Tool Figma Launches With $14M To Fight Adobe|url=https://techcrunch.com/2015/12/03/figma-vs-goliath/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201102144427/https://techcrunch.com/2015/12/03/figma-vs-goliath/|archive-date=November 2, 2020|access-date=November 15, 2020|website=TechCrunch}}</ref> In February 2018, Figma raised $25 million in a Series B round (lead investor Kleiner Perkins).<ref>{{Cite web|last=Sawers|first=Paul|date=February 2, 2018|title=Figma raises $25 million to take on Adobe with a browser-based interface design tool|url=https://venturebeat.com/2018/02/02/figma-raises-25-million-to-take-on-adobe-and-invision-with-its-browser-based-interface-design-tool/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201109033341/https://venturebeat.com/2018/02/02/figma-raises-25-million-to-take-on-adobe-and-invision-with-its-browser-based-interface-design-tool/|archive-date=November 9, 2020|access-date=November 15, 2020|website=VentureBeat}}</ref> 

In February 2019, Figma raised $40 million in Series C funding (lead investor Sequoia Capital).<ref name=":0" /> In April 2020, Figma raised $50 million in a Series D funding round (lead investor Andreessen Horowitz).<ref name="forbes">{{Cite web|last=Konrad|first=Alex|date=April 30, 2020|title=Figma Eyes Acquisitions, New Tools With $50 Million In Fresh Funding At $2 Billion Valuation|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexkonrad/2020/04/30/figma-raises-funding-eyes-acquisitions/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201115074846/https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexkonrad/2020/04/30/figma-raises-funding-eyes-acquisitions/?sh=7ca9a2d711ea|archive-date=November 15, 2020|access-date=November 15, 2020|website=Forbes}}</ref> In June 2021, Figma raised $200 million in a Series E funding round (lead investor Durable Capital Partners).<ref name="chapman">{{Cite web|title=Software Design Startup Figma Is Now Worth $10 Billion|first=Lizette|last=Chapman|url=https://www.bnnbloomberg.ca/software-design-startup-figma-is-now-worth-10-billion-1.1621267|date=2021-06-24|website=BNN Bloomberg}}</ref>

Figma was valued at more than $2 billion by April 2020<ref name="forbes" /><ref>{{cite web |title=Figma Revenue and Competitors|url=https://growjo.com/company/Figma|url-status=usurped|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201128001438/https://growjo.com/company/Figma|archive-date=28 November 2020|website=Growjo |access-date=19 November 2020}}</ref> and $10 billion by the end of May 2021.<ref name=chapman/> After the Adobe acquisition of Figma at a $20 billion valuation fell through in December 2023, CB Insights noted that based on earning metrics, Figma would be worth between $8.3-9 billion.<ref>{{Cite web |last=CB Insights |date=December 18, 2023 |title=Figma's valuation is $8.3B-$9B, a haircut to the $20B Adobe offered |url=https://www.cbinsights.com/research/figma-valuation-adobe/ |access-date=April 29, 2024 |website=CB Insights}}</ref>
